intro: Dieudonnaea idroboi, commonly known as the Icahua plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dieudonnaea idroboi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and rocky slopes.
